main.title: Powered by StakeKit
main.description: StakeKit is a powerful API & widget for self-custodial staking. It supports the most popular tokens and chains out of the box, and provides a beautiful, seamless experience.

staking.title: What is Staking?
staking.description: Staking is a way to earn passive income by holding and "staking" your cryptocurrency. It helps secure the network and validate transactions, while rewarding you with additional tokens for your contribution.

liquid_staking.title: What is Liquid Staking?
liquid_staking.description: Liquid crypto staking lets you earn rewards by staking your cryptocurrency while still keeping it easily accessible for trading or other purposes. It's a flexible way to make your crypto work for you without locking it up, allowing you to enjoy the benefits of staking while maintaining liquidity.

deposit.title: What are yield vault deposits?
deposit.description: Yield deposit vaults, like Yearn Finance (YFI), automatically optimize your crypto investments for higher returns. By pooling funds and using advanced strategies across DeFi protocols, these vaults generate passive yield. Enjoy higher interest rates and benefit from professional yield farming expertise with a hands-off approach to earning more from your crypto.

lending.title: What is lending?
lending.description: Crypto lending platforms, such as Aave, allow you to lend your digital assets and earn interest on them. By depositing your crypto into lending pools, you become a lender, and borrowers can access your funds in exchange for paying interest. It's a way to put your idle crypto to work and earn passive income while helping others access the funds they need.

fees.title: About fees
fees.description: Crypto network fees, also known as gas fees, are the costs associated with executing transactions or smart contracts on a blockchain network. These fees ensure the prioritization and security of transactions. Higher demand and congestion can lead to increased gas fees, while lower fees may result in slower transaction processing.

geo_block.title: Geo Block
geo_block.ofac: This feature is not available in {{countryName}}. {{countryName}} is on the Office of Foreign Assets Control (“OFAC”) list of sanctioned countries. You can learn more about OFAC and its sanctions programs here <link0>https://ofac.treasury.gov/sanctions-programs-and-country-information</link0>.
geo_block.ofsi: This feature is not available in {{countryName}}. {{countryName}} is on the U.K.’s Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation (“OFSI”) list of sanctioned countries. You can learn more about OFSI and its sanctions programs here <link0>https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/financial-sanctions-regime-specific-consolidated-lists-and-releases</link0>.
geo_block.pending_litigation: This feature is currently unavailable in {{nameOfRegion}} due to pending litigation on the subject of staking cryptocurrencies
geo_block.crypto_ban: This feature is not available in {{countryName}}. {{countryName}} has implemented firm regulations against the use of cryptocurrencies. Please refer to official {{countryName}} resources to learn more.
geo_block.staking_ban: This feature is not available in {{countryName}}. The Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”) of {{countryName}} has restricted digital asset business operators from offering staking services. You can learn more about the SEC regualtions here <link0>https://www.sec.or.th/TH/Pages/News_Detail.aspx?SECID=10018</link0>.
geo_block.ofsi_crypto_ban: This feature is not available in {{countryName}}. {{countryName}} is on the U.K.’s Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation (“OFSI”) list of sanctioned countries. You can learn more about OFSI and its sanctions programs here <link0>https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/financial-sanctions-regime-specific-consolidated-lists-and-releases</link0>. {{countryName}} has further implemented firm regulations against the use of cryptocurrencies.
geo_block.ofac_ofsi: This feature is not available in {{countryName}}. {{countryName}} is on both the Office of Foreign Assets Control (“OFAC”) list of sanctioned countries, as well as the U.K.’s Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation (“OFSI”) list of sanctioned countries. You can learn more about OFAC and its sanctions programs here <link0>https://ofac.treasury.gov/sanctions-programs-and-country-information</link0>, as well as OFSI and its sanctions programs here <link>https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/financial-sanctions-regime-specific-consolidated-lists-and-releases</link>.
